description: Borrowed from Portuguese copra, from Malayalam കൊപ്ര (kopra), from Sanskrit कपालः (kapālaḥ, “skull”). Doublet of kapala.

entries.meaning: The dried kernel of the coconut, from which coconut oil is extruded.
examples: She burnt a small quantity of straw and copra in an earthern incense bowl and took it out to him.
